entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued August 20 at 5:02PM AKDT until August 21 at 7:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Sitka. * WHEN...Until 7 AM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to low visibility.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 3:14PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Glacier Dammed lake release causing debris to flow into Controller Bay... Satellite observations indicate that the Berg glacier dammed lake, located 65 miles east of Cordova, has likely released downstream into the Gandil River, Bering River and Bering Lake. High water from this glacier dammed lake release usually lasts for several days with large areas

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued August 20 at 1:07PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A High Surf Advisory remains in effect... * WHAT...Surf of 10 to 13 feet. * WHERE...South and east facing shores of all islands. * WHEN...through Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor. Expect some strong breaking waves, shorebreak, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued August 20 at 8:31PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR NORTHEASTERN WRIGHT... SOUTHEASTERN LACLEDE AND WEST CENTRAL TEXAS COUNTIES IS CANCELLED... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer poses an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning has been cancelled. entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Utah, including Grand County near Cisco. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM MDT.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 7:10PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Grand County through 745 PM MDT... At 709 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cisco, 17 miles north of Castle Valley, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 5:08PM MDT until August 20 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Utah, including mainly rural areas of South Central Uintah County approximately 50 miles south of Vernal and 50 miles northeast of Green River.

entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued August 20 at 2:38PM PDT until August 22 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED ACROSS EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE MONDAY AFTERNOON... .A disturbance crossing the area Sunday night is expected to result in isolated thunderstorms overnight becoming scattered during the day on Monday. entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 20 at 9:05AM CDT until August 20 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous swimming conditions are expected along the Lake Superior shoreline due to high wave action and strong rip currents. * WHERE...Minnesota Park Point and Wisconsin Point Beaches.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 9:09PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Ritchie, southern Doddridge and north central Gilmer Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 909 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Glenville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail.
